subclusters.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Centered Free Radical Theory
Protein Oxidation and Nitrosative Stress Free Radical Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial electron transport chain as the main source of free radicals causing aging and the effect of caloric restriction on mitochondrial ROS.
Classical free radical aging theory emphasizing ROS accumulation mainly from mitochondria and mitohormesis as a mitochondrial ROS adaptive response.
Emphasizes ROS-induced lipid peroxidation as a key mechanism linking free radicals to aging and age-related diseases like atherosclerosis.
Focuses on lipid peroxidation accumulation with age and dietary restriction effects on lipid composition and peroxidation.
Highlights lipid peroxidation markers (pentane, ethane) increasing with age and suppression by food restriction.
Discusses membrane lipid peroxidation damage in aging and antioxidant/dietary restriction modulation of lipid oxidative damage.
Describes age-related lipid peroxidation increases in brain tissue and decline in antioxidant enzymes contributing to oxidative damage.
Focuses on mitochondria as major ROS source causing oxidative damage accumulation in skeletal muscle aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production and mitochondrial protein oxidation as central to aging.
Links energy restriction effects on mitochondrial proton leak and ROS production to aging modulation.
Focuses on ROS accumulation from mitochondria causing age-related memory impairment and antioxidant defenses.
Studies mitochondrial free radical accumulation and oxidative stress response gene regulation in aging.
Examines mitochondrial ROS, oxygen tension, and oxidative damage effects on lifespan and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Centered Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative DNA damage accumulation (8-OHdG) as a marker and mechanism of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Centered Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes age-related oxidative DNA damage accumulation and dietary restriction effects on DNA damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Centered Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS effects on brain aging, synaptic plasticity, and antioxidant enzyme modulation, highlighting DNA damage and signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Centered Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses reactive oxygen intermediates causing molecular damage including DNA and the protective role of melatonin.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Centered Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative damage accumulation to DNA, proteins, and lipids including endocrine gland aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Nitrosative Stress Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative and nitrosative modifications causing protein damage, aggregation, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Nitrosative Stress Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes protein oxidative modifications, failure of protein maintenance systems, and their role in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Nitrosative Stress Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative protein damage, selective protein oxidation, proteolytic impairment, and protein aggregation in aging brain.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Nitrosative Stress Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes free radical-induced decline in proteolytic capacity due to oxidative modifications of proteolytic enzymes and proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Nitrosative Stress Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on methionine sulfoxide reductase system repairing oxidized proteins and its role in oxidative stress protection and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Peroxisomal Function and Free Radical Detoxification Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes peroxisomes' role in ROS detoxification, decline in peroxisomal function with age, and impact on oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Oxidative Damage-Centered Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General oxidative stress theory focusing on ROS-induced damage to DNA, proteins, and lipids and cellular defense mechanisms.
